item.title: HP 17-Inch Laptop with Windows 11 Pro Is $1,560 Off, Now Going for Pennies Right After Prime Day
item.content:encoded:
Most people need a laptop that covers the basics reliably: smooth web browsing, comfortable document editing, video calls that don’t freeze and enough screen space to actually see what you’re working on. This HP laptop checks every box on that list and delivers a spacious 17.3-inch FHD display, an Intel i3-N305 8-core processor, 16GB of DDR4 RAM, and a generous 1TB SSD. Right now, this machine is down to $639 on Amazon, slashed from its typical $2,199 price. This all-time low didn’t even show up during Prime Day last week.

See at Amazon

The Intel i3-N305 processor has a surprising amount of muscle to deliver for an i3 chip. With the ability to run 8 cores and 8 threads and turbo speeds that can hit as high as 3.8GHz, this processor can handle office workflows, multimedia, and multitasking situations that would slow older budget notebooks to a crawl. Those 8 cores enable you to have dozens of browser tabs and video conferencing programs running, edit docs, and stream music and still never have a slowdown. By delivering responsive speeds to heavy duty programs like photo editing or analyzing a spreadsheet, this notebook has the capacity to do much more than simple web browsing and email.

A Display that makes Everything Easier to View

That 17.3-inch diagonal display transforms your computer experience in ways you may not anticipate until you’ve experienced it. Additional screen real estate translates to less scrolling to documents, effortless use of windows side-by-side and real productivity boosts working in spreadsheets or graphics applications. FHD resolution of 1920×1080 maintains text sharp and images clear and IPS panel technologies deliver true colors over extremely wide viewing angles.

Anti-glare coating minimizes eye strain when you’ll be sitting for long periods which is essential when you’ll be looking at the display for hours on end. Narrow bezel design makes maximum use of the screen real estate without making the laptop too large and innovative lift-hinge design raises the keyboard when you open the lid to form a steeper and more upright typing angle that minimizes wrist strain.

The 16GB DDR4 RAM has enough headroom to handle current computing needs: This memory capacity allows you to have several applications running smoothly, jump between applications quickly without loading times, and hold dozens of web pages without slow downs. The 1TB PCIe NVMe solid-state drive provides incredibly fast boot times, normally propelling you from power button to desktop in less than 10 seconds. File transfers occur virtually right away, and programs launch the moment their icons are clicked. Storage capacity also allows you to have your complete digital library stored right on the laptop without having to constantly manage it or rely on external storage units.

Battery life can go as long as 8 hours due to the use of HP Fast Charge technology and it allows you to work throughout a day of meetings or travels and not have to search for outlets. HP True Vision HD camera provides clear video resolution even when you are in a low-light environment which eradicates the universal headache of having grainy, dark video calls while working in darkened rooms.

Windows 11 Pro comes standard with the built-in Copilot AI assistant which can be accessed via a specialized keyboard key. This AI aide can provide answers to questions, summarize documents, create text, and automate many other tasks, all without having to leave your workstation. A full-size keyboard, complete with a numeric keypad that every person working with numbers or performing data entry will love, comes included as well.

With that $639 purchase price, you’re receiving a laptop that normally costs over three times as much.

item.title: LEGO Grogu Set with Hover Pram Is Selling for Pennies, Amazon Clears Out Stock at a New Record Low
item.content:encoded:
If there’s one Lego license that consistently flies off the shelves, it’s Star Wars. These sets rarely see significant discounts, which makes today’s deal even more remarkable. The Lego Star Wars Grogu with hover pram building set has dropped to $69 on Amazon, down from its usual $99 price tag. This is the first time this incredibly popular set (boasting an impressive 4.9 out of 5 stars) has hit such a record low price.

See at Amazon

This 1,048-piece building set brings everybody’s beloved Force-sensitive foundling to life in breathtaking detail. Over 7.5 inches tall when standing in his hover pram, it’s not just another fast-assembly figure. Thoughtful engineering allows you to interact with the model long after you’ve finished building it and it captures Grogu’s undeniable charm. With a dial-controlled arm mechanism, you have complete control over Grogu’s gestures to recreate those iconic moments when he reaches out to touch whatever comes his attention or attempts to use his powers. His head smoothly turns to freeze various expressions, and his characteristic oversized ears can be set to demonstrate curiosity, sleepiness, or wakefulness.

Why This Set Provides the Magic of The Mandalorian

The hover pram itself is a 7-inch long and 6-inch wide base that doubles as a display piece. It’s the flexibility of having a choice in how you display this build that makes it so interesting. You can display Grogu safely nestled inside his safety pod just as Din Djarin carries him when out adventuring or standing him upright outside for a more dynamic display.

Lego didn’t hold back on the accessories that transformed Grogu into a cultural icon. Three key items that epitomize his personality are included in the set: a brick-built Sorgan frog (don’t you recall his snacking ways from Season 1?), the shifter knob from the Razor Crest that became a meme immediately, and a cookie that he can hold in his miniature hands.

The advanced level of this 1,048-piece set makes it ideal for builders aged 10 and up but adult collectors will relish the building process as much. The piece count assures hours of uninterrupted building time which makes it an ideal weekend project or a relaxing evening activity. While other, simpler sets may have you racing to get to the final stages, you’ll have time to smell the Lego, as it were, as you assemble the mechanical components that give Grogu’s movement life.

With the $30 savings, it comes to a price that is difficult to pass up, particularly since those Star Wars sets tend to hold their value or gain it over time.

item.title: Galaxy Buds 3 Pro Are Going for Pennies, the New AirPods Pro Can’t Compete at Full Price
item.content:encoded:
Apple just released the AirPods Pro 3 a few weeks ago and finally added AI features that Samsung’s Galaxy Buds 3 Pro have had for nearly a year now. Samsung got ahead with AI features in its Galaxy Buds 3 Pro, which launched way back and still remain at the top of their game. From a value perspective, they’re even more compelling now with this post-Prime Day deal on Amazon that drops them to a record low of $172, down from their usual $249 price.

See at Amazon

The AI integration goes beyond marketing buzzwords and actually improves your listening experience in practical ways. The Galaxy Buds 3 Pro use machine learning to analyze your ear canal shape and ambient noise conditions, then automatically adjust sound output to optimize audio quality for your specific situation. This means the earbuds adapt when you move from a quiet office to a loud street, or when you switch from music to podcasts, adjusting EQ and volume levels on the fly. The real-time translation feature lets you have conversations across language barriers with audio playing directly in your ears as someone speaks in another language. This AI capability transforms these earbuds into a communication tool rather than just an audio device.

Active Noise Cancellation That Really Works

The active noise canceling system incorporates multiple microphones that cancel out external noise over the full frequency spectrum. Rumble from motors or HVAC is cancelled out very effectively, while mid-level noise such as voice conversations and typing on the keyboard drop into the background. The adaptive ANC modulates the level depending on where you are so you’re not draining the battery with full cancellation when you’re already sitting in silence. Ambient sound mode does the opposite, streaming external sounds in over the microphones so you hear announcements, traffic, or brisk conversations without removing the earbuds.

Samsung reworked the fit around the Galaxy Buds 3 Pro based on complaints from previous iterations. The new blade design with tilted nozzles fit deeper into the ear canal with more even pressure distribution. It makes a difference during exercises, commutes or marathon listening sessions where ill-fitting earbuds will fall out or make uncomfortable pressure points. The IP57 rating also means dust and water resistance so you won’t harm them by sweating during exercise or getting caught in the rain. The protective coverage even extends to immersion under up to one meter’s depth of water for 30 minutes, although you won’t be swimming with them.

Sound quality is improved by dual-driver construction that decouples the low frequency from the mid and high frequency response. The low end is covered by a specialized woofer and the high end and midrange by a specialized tweeter. The decoupling makes for clearer sound with better detail compared to single-driver earbuds that are not capable of accurately playing the full frequency response.

Battery life is around six hours with ANC enabled and around eight hours with ANC disabled. The charging case adds around 20 hours or so so you’ll have enough time before you’ll want to recharge. Fast charging will give you around an hour’s play from five minutes’ charging if time is extremely limited. The Amazon Exclusive version comes with a two-year warranty rather than the one-year coverage you get otherwise, so you have even greater assurance for your pound.

The all-time low price makes the earbuds an extremely smart purchase this time.

item.title: Jackery’s 1500W Power Station Is Cheaper Than During Prime Day, Looks Like Amazon’s Selling at Cost
item.content:encoded:
Prime Big Deal Day took place from October 7th through October 8th, and Amazon doubled down from July’s Prime Day by cutting the price to all-time lows on nearly all product lines. The Jackery Explorer 1000 portable power station dropped to an all-time low during the sales event and remains at that same $429 price point, down from the $799 price point consumers will pay until existing stock is sold out.

See at Amazon

This product has been the category’s number one bestseller on Amazon since the first day of the month. Power outages, camping excursions, tailgating parties and even emergency planning all have one thing in common: the need for good backup electricity that doesn’t come from noisy gas-based generators. The Jackery product addresses this very same issue by delivering clean, silent power that you can tote around with one hand and enjoy indoors without hassle from fumes nor carbon monoxide.

The Explorer 1000 stores a 1,070Wh LiFePO4 battery capacity into an amazingly small package weighing only 23.8 pounds. That capability translates into tangible runtime in the real world: you’ll power a mini-fridge for around 10 hours, power a CPAP machine overnight over multiple nights, sustain laptops and cellphones for multiple days, or power LED lights for an extended time. With the 1,500W continuous AC output but 3,000W surge peak, this power station supports appliances drawing much power during startups such as refrigerators, portable air conditioners, or electric kettles.

Speeding Up Charges and Lasting Batteries That Alter the Equation

The fast charging for one hour is quite impressive and is only accessed by activating the emergency charging mode from the Jackery app. It is ideal when you are aware bad weather is imminent or you want to quickly get it topped up before you leave. The standard charging mode will take 1.7 hours for full charging that is something the manufacturers made deliberate for the best preservation of long-term battery health. The slow charging decreases the strain on the cell from the battery, giving them an extended lifespan.

LiFePO4 batteries are the key to this power station’s longevity: Unlike standard lithium-ion batteries that degrade relatively quickly, LiFePO4 chemistry maintains over 70% of original capacity even after 4,000 charge cycles. In practical terms, if you fully charge and discharge this power station once per week, it’ll still perform well after a decade of use.

The port assortment accomodates the majority of general devices and setups. Three pure sine AC outlets supply clean power safe for sensitive electronics such as laptops, medical equipment, and digital-control-enabled modern appliances. Two USB-C ports supply up to 100W PD fast charging so you’ll be able to charge contemporary laptops at full speed without the need for heavy power adapters. One is relegated to older devices, with the DC car port supporting 12V accessories.

The Jackery app adds smart controls that actually improve the user experience: You can switch between charging modes, monitor battery levels and power draw in real time, and activate the 30dB quiet overnight charging mode when noise matters. Energy efficiency mode adjusts output to reduce waste when powering low-draw devices. The integrated LED lights provide emergency illumination without draining your phone’s battery.

Coming in at $429, this Jackery Explorer 1000 brings serious power capacity, and decade-spanning battery longevity all for almost half the going price.

item.title: Bose Is Quietly Selling Its QC Headphones at a New Record Low After Prime Day to Clear Out Stock
item.content:encoded:
Amazon’s October answer to the summer Prime Day event (Prime Big Deal Day) just wrapped up but some of the best deals are still hanging around. The Bose QuietComfort headphones are a perfect example, now sitting at a record low of $199, down from their usual $349 price. These are the most popular premium noise-canceling headphones in the world for a reason: they solve the problem of trying to focus, relax, or enjoy music in noisy environments better than almost anything else on the market.

See at Amazon

The Bose QuietComfort headphones’ active noise cancellation does what the name suggests – canceling out noise – by using microphones to listen for external noise and then creating countering sound waves to eliminate the noise. This all occurs in real time so background noise such as engine rumble, air flow from the air conditioning or background chatter all get greatly alleviated. Bose overlays this with passive noise isolation from the over-ear design itself where the cushy earcup cushions form an actual physical seal around the ears. The active-passive noise reduction mixture makes that classic “quiet bubble” result that makes the headphones so desirable among travelers and remote workers.

Comfort Engineering That Makes All-Day Wear Actually Possible

The earcup cushions incorporate soft materials that wrap around your ears without applying too much force and distributes weight evenly so you don’t feel any pressure points. The cushioned headband keeps the headphones firmly in place during movement but doesn’t develop that ill-fitting clamp sensation causing headaches after an hour. The design for comfort is important because these headphones provide up to 24 hours of battery power from one charging. That’s multiple intercontinental flights, some workweeks, or an infinite number of daily commutes before you have to recharge them. Should you unexpectedly run low, 15 minutes of charging provides 2.5 hours of subsequent playtime which is enough to get you through the rest of your trip or workweek.

Two modes for listening give you the choice depending on the circumstances: Quiet Mode engages full noise cancellation as much as possible, ideal when you’re working or sleeping on a trip. Aware Mode does the reverse and uses external microphones to feed external sounds so you’ll hear announcements or traffic without having to lift the headphones.

The high-fidelity audio reproduction provides excellent sound throughout the frequency spectrum with the EQ settings in the Bose app allowing you to tailor the bass, midrange, and treble to suit. Some users desire booming bass for dance/electronica, while others want well-balanced reproduction for classical or jazz. The app puts the settings in your hand so the same headphones suit varied genres and individual taste.

The multipoint Bluetooth connectivity allows you to connect to multiple devices at the same time so the headphones remain connected to laptop and phone. If you receive an incoming call on the phone while you’re streaming something on the laptop, the headphones will automatically switch to the phone without needing you to manually detach from one device and connect to the other.

The packaged audio cable with the in-line microphone gives you the option of going wired when you don’t have access to Bluetooth or when the battery dies. This is the kind of feature that is actually useful on outdated airplane entertainment sets or where wireless connectivity is not an option. At $199, you get flagship-level noise cancellation and excellent battery life all at close to half the full price.
